info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 13 at 8:16PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...The Forest Service Bridger Teton Avalanche Center in Jackson has CONTINUED a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING which is in effect until 10 PM MST Sunday... * WHAT...The combination of new snow and strong winds falling on a weak snowpack have created widespread areas of unstable snow. Avalanche danger will remain elevated with very dangerous conditions through Sunday. * WHERE...The mountains of western Wyoming including the Snake River, Salt River, Wyoming, Gros Ventre and Teton Ranges. The mountains of southeast Idaho including the Palisades, Elk Mountains and Big Holes. * WHEN...In effect from Thu 17:50 MST to Sun 22:00 MST. * IMPACTS...Natural and human-triggered avalanches large enough to bury people are almost certain to occur. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Stay off of and out from below slopes steeper than about 30 degrees. Avalanches may be triggered remotelyâ€”from flat terrain above, below, and to the sides of steep slopes. Natural and human-triggered avalanches may involve deeper weak layers of snow and produce a larger avalanche than expected. Avalanches could run onto low angle terrain, hitting paths, roads or groomed snowmobile trails. Consult www.btavy.org or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
